result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe L. Edwards Jr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joe L. Edwards Jr in court.  Attorney Gregory Bates in court for Joe L. Edwards Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:21 PM  
  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Greg Bates.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on 9/27/22  @ 9:00am  before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI  Bond is continued.   jk
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant Joe L. Edwards in court.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:   SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Josette P

02:02 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 8-11-22 @9am. $500   Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). EC
and witness list filed by the State
